body:
This replaces crate::rest_api::*_PROTOCOL_VERSION with a single
SPLINTER_PROTOCOL_VERSION. This is consistent with the original
intended design and the future direction of the entire Splinter REST API
being versioned as a whole (as opposed to versioned per-component).

title: Backport 0-6: Enclose http statuses in quotes in openapi.yaml

labels.name: backport-pr
labels.description: This PR has been backported from main or another newer release branch.

body:
The openapi standard states that all http statuses should be enclosed in
quotes for cross compatibility between yaml and json representations.
This commit encloses all status codes in the file.

For reference:
https://spec.openapis.org/oas/latest.html#responses-object

Section 4.8.16.2 contains the relevant bits of the standard.

Signed-off-by: Caleb Hill <hill@bitwise.io>

labels.name: backport-0-6

labels.description: This PR has been backported to the appropriate branches

body:
This change adds support for an Arc-RwLock-wrapped SQLite pool in scabbard as a configuration option. 
It adds the ability to create a `SqliteStoreFactory` from an existing arc-rwlock-pool. It configures splinterd to use this type of wrapper for SQLite.

title: Backport 0-6: Update gameroom to use CircuitTemplateManager
body:
This replaces the use of CircuitCreateTemplate that was used
previously and updates gameroom to follow the same pattern as
the splinter CLI.

Previously, the CLI was broken and when fixed, broke gamerooms
ability to find its template. Having them use the same method
allows them both to work without conflicts.

Signed-off-by: Andrea Gunderson <agunde@bitwise.io>

Also update version of protobuf used to 2.19.

The version was previously enforced to stay 2.18, however

compatibility with them.

title: Release notes for 0.4.2
body: Signed-off-by: Andrea Gunderson <agunde@bitwise.io>

title: 0-6 Backport: Implement splinter state migrate command
body:
Implement command to move scabbard state to or from LMDB, deleting from the input database.
```
splinter state migrate -h
splinter-state-migrate 
Move scabbard state to or from LMDB, deleting from the input database

USAGE:
    splinter state migrate [FLAGS] [OPTIONS]

FLAGS:
    -f, --force      Always attempt to move state, regardless of if there is existing data in the out database
    -h, --help       Prints help information
    -q, --quiet      Do not display output
    -V, --version    Prints version information
    -v               Log verbosely
    -y, --yes        Do not prompt for confirmation

OPTIONS:
        --in <in>                  Database URI that currently contains the scabbard state. If state is in individual
                                   LMDB files, provide `lmdb`
        --out <out>                The database URI the scabbard state should end up in. If state should be put into
                                   individual LMDB files, provide `lmdb`
        --state-dir <state_dir>    The location of the state directory for the LMDB files
```
To test, start up to splinterd with lmdb scabbard state configured and create circuit and submit some txn.

Then run the following command to move the migrate the scabbard data for on of the splinter daemons

`splinter state migrate --in lmdb --out SQLITE_OR_POSTGRES_SPLINTER_DATABASE `

And then restart the splinter daemons, without lmdb configured for the daemon whose state was migrated. In the data directory, there should be no LMDB files remaining. You can do the reverse to move the scabbard state out into LMDB files as well.

title: Log default adjustment

title: Update gameroom to use CircuitTemplateManager
body:
This replaces the use of CircuitCreateTemplate that was used
previously and updates gameroom to follow the same pattern as
the splinter CLI.

Previously, the CLI was broken and when fixed, broke gamerooms
ability to find its template. Having them use the same method
allows them both to work without conflicts.

Signed-off-by: Andrea Gunderson <agunde@bitwise.io>

title: Fix 401 in tests
body:
This PR fixes a bug that was found in the two REST API endpoint tests. The logs for the tests showed "The server didn't upgrade: 401 Unauthorized" when the test attempted to send a request to the `/ws/admin/register/{}` endpoint. These two tests use an actual authorization handler instead of the mock handler so when any request is sent to the REST API it must have a valid auth header. The admin service event client for the node was being created with "foo" as the auth string, causing any requests it made to fail.

- Update the testing framework so that you can set the auth header that will be used by the admin service even client when submitting requests. If no auth header is set "foo" will still be used by default.
- Update the REST API endpoint tests to pass in an auth string created with the admin signer's JWT when creating the test network.

title: Remove leading underscore from log_handle variable
body:
The underscore was needed at one point to avoid a lint error. Now that
log-config is stabilized the lint error is no more. This commit renames
`_log_handle` to `log_handle`.

Signed-off-by: Caleb Hill <hill@bitwise.io>

title: Backport clippy fixes 0 6
body: Backport of main lint fixes.

title: Implement `splinter state migrate` command
body:
Implement command to move scabbard state to or from LMDB, deleting from the input database.

```
splinter state migrate -h
splinter-state-migrate 
Move scabbard state to or from LMDB, deleting from the input database

USAGE:
    splinter state migrate [FLAGS] [OPTIONS]

FLAGS:
    -f, --force      Always attempt to move state, regardless of if there is existing data in the out database
    -h, --help       Prints help information
    -q, --quiet      Do not display output
    -V, --version    Prints version information
    -v               Log verbosely
    -y, --yes        Do not prompt for confirmation

OPTIONS:
        --in <in>                  Database URI that currently contains the scabbard state. If state is in individual
                                   LMDB files, provide `lmdb`
        --out <out>                The database URI the scabbard state should end up in. If state should be put into
                                   individual LMDB files, provide `lmdb`
        --state-dir <state_dir>    The location of the state directory for the LMDB files
```

To test, start up to splinterd with lmdb scabbard state configured and create circuit and submit some txn. 

Then run the following command to move the migrate the scabbard data for on of the splinter daemons
```
splinter state migrate --in lmdb --out SQLITE_OR_POSTGRES_SPLINTER_DATABASE 
```

And then restart the splinter daemons, without lmdb configured for the daemon whose state was migrated. In the data directory, there should be no LMDB files remaining. You can do the reverse to move the scabbard state out into LMDB files as well.

labels.description: This PR breaks backward compatibily for a public API

On creation there is always a "default" tree, this should
not be considered existing SQL Merkle Radix trees if LMDB is
enabled.

title: Adjust default loggers to exclude extra logs
body:
Set root logger level to `Warn` and add loggers for `splinter` and
`splinterd` with levels Info.

Signed-off-by: Caleb Hill <hill@bitwise.io>

title: Add JUSTX_CARGO_TEST_ARGS and JUSTX_TEST_BINARY_ARGS
body:
These allow setting arguments on cargo test when running 'just test'.
The prefix JUSTX_ was chosen because we want this to be cross-project,
but the prefix JUST_ is used by the just command itself.

JUSTX_CARGO_TEST_ARGS allows setting arguments on cargo test itself.

JUSTX_TEST_BINARY_ARGS allows setting arguments on the test binary; this
is passed after the "--" to cargo test.

Examples:

  JUSTX_CARGO_TEST_ARGS="-j 6" just test
  JUSTX_TEST_BINARY_ARGS="--test-threads=6" just test
  JUSTX_TEST_BINARY_ARGS="admin::service --test-threads=6" just test

title: Update flexi-logger dependency to v0.20
body:
In addition to updating the dependency version, this commit also changes
the gameroom daemon logging to use flexi-logger's built-in with_thread
formatter. This prevents needing to pull in the 'time' crate with the
new flexi-logger API.

title: Remove is_ok when calling scabbard and admin
Remove health service
body:
This change removes the health service, both from splinterd and the repository in general.

The health service, as it stands, is merely skeleton code that prior to this commit was providing no value and slowing down the build times.

As the service API will be undergoing radical redesign in future releases, the health service should be re-introduced after those designs have been finalized.

title: Update influxdb dependency
body:
This change updates the influxdb dependency to 0.5, as well as the specific tokio instance used for influxdb communication from 0.2 to 1.x.

This fixes the metrics not correctly writing to influxdb as well.

title: Fail if SQL trees exist if scabbard-state=lmdb is enabled
body:
To test: 

Setup two nodes with the default database settings (i.e. sqlite).  Create a scabbard circuit and commit at least one transaction.

Restart one of the nodes with the added argument of `--scabbard-state lmdb`.  This should fail to start with an error about the invalid state configuration.

title: Backport: Update node base image in some Dockerfiles
body:
node:lts-alpine was updated to be based on alpine 3.14 instead of 3.11
and use node v16 instead of v14. gameroom-app currentely is incompatible
with node v16.

Signed-off-by: Ryan Beck-Buysse <rbuysse@bitwise.io>

title: Add a way to set authorization header in the 0.4 ScabbardClient
body:
This will enable a client that using the ScabbardClient to work
against a 0.5/0.6 splinter node by adding a Cylinder JWT
authorization header.

Signed-off-by: Andrea Gunderson <agunde@bitwise.io>

title: Add default for rolling_file size
body:
The default is set at 100Mb. The default value is set in the
config::logger module as opposed to config::toml because config::toml is
only concerned with deserialization and not providing defaults.  While
config::logger deals with all the details of converting a deserialized
struct to one we can actually use.

Signed-off-by: Caleb Hill <hill@bitwise.io>

Logging struct imports were inconsistently imported, this commit
condenses use statments and changes `crate` based uses to `super` uses
with in the config module.

title: Remove unnecessary Deserialize derives
body:
These structs are never deserialized and extra derives slow compilation.

Signed-off-by: Caleb Hill <hill@bitwise.io>

title: Update several dependencies in the splinter repository
body: Updates log, gag, dirs, flexi-logger, and reqwest.

title: Stabilize log config
body: Removes the feature

title: Update example config to use file appender
body:
Previously there were two examples with rolling_file appenders and none with
file appenders. This change converts one of those example rolling_file appenders
to a file appender. This more completely documents the logging subsystem for
administrators.

Signed-off-by: Caleb Hill <hill@bitwise.io>

title: Add feature guard for testing import
body:
log::Level is used by one test that is feature guarded. When you run
`just build` it will output warnings that theres an unused import for
stable and default feature builds. This commit just add the guard to
avoid the warning.

Signed-off-by: Caleb Hill <hill@bitwise.io>

title: Add 0.5.25 release notes
body: Signed-off-by: Isabel Tomb <tomb@bitwise.io>

title: Remove `scabbard sp` commands and update man pages
body:
Remove experimental smart permission sub commands. Support has been removed from an upcoming Sabre release. Since they were experimental this does not change the stable API.

Also includes updates to man pages.

title: Stabilize cli/scabbard-migrations by removing it
body: This change stabilizes the CLI feature "scabbard-migrations" by removing the feature.  Its functionality is covered by the "upgrade" feature.

title: Create gameroom db as lib instead of bin in splinter-dev
body:
Fixes an issue where dependencies were not being properly cached which
led to longer build times.

Signed-off-by: Ryan Beck-Buysse <rbuysse@bitwise.io>

title: Stabilize database-support
body:
This PR stabilizes `"scabbard/database-support"` and `"splinterd/scabbard-database-support"`

It also cleans up the code structure as a result of the stabilizations.

title: Man page updates for splinter registery, role and upgrade CLI commands
Update the root logger to allow levels below info
body:
The default root logger had a preset level filter of info, which conflicted
with `-vv` and `-vvv` verbosity flags if the root logger wasn't
overridden in splinterd.toml. The value is now trace so all logs will
get forwarded to appenders.

Signed-off-by: Caleb Hill <hill@bitwise.io>

title: More scabbard-database-support feature fixes
body: This is a set of feature guard commits related to the feature "scabbard/database-support", and will come into play when stabilized.

title: Shutdown the network in /veil/scabbard tests
body:
These tests were not being shut down properly.

Signed-off-by: Andrea Gunderson <agunde@bitwise.io>

title: Add default log config tests
body: Adds a test to check you can override our default loggers. Also adds code so the test passes.

title: Refactor byte size
body: Simplifies the ByteSize type and moves it into the toml module.

title: Scabbard feature improvements
body: This PR updates the feature guards such that the `"database-support"` feature can be compiled without databases (a necessary detail when the feature is removed during stabilization).

title: More man page update for splinter CLI
Use CircuitTemplate::load_from_file to use the file_path directly
body:
Every time this is used it is passed the entire file path. The file
path was found from the default and env variables previously.

Trying to find a file based on the full file path would cause the
file to not be found, and thus the show and argument CLI commands
would fail.

title: Update log example configuration
body:
Add more and better explanation of how the system works.

Add included a new section for 'Advanced' log config topics.

Add notes the logger.appenders field is optional for non root logger,
and that the logger.level field is also optional for non root loggers
but will be filled in with the root logger level if left blank.

Signed-off-by: Caleb Hill <hill@bitwise.io>

title: Add "scabbard-service" default feature
body: This PR creates a `"scabbard-service"` default feature, around the grandfathered-in "stable" service code.  This will allow the CLI to only depend on the client, which will remove some very tricky feature guards when `"scabbard/database-support"` is stabilized.

title: Pull in correct admin messages for gameroom
body:
Gameroom was setting SplinterProtocolVersion to 1. This is correct
for gameroom but changes had been made to make gameroom handle
v2 versions of admin events. Now that admin events version is
guarded by protocol version, the v1 messages can be used instead.

Signed-off-by: Andrea Gunderson <agunde@bitwise.io>

title: Update axios version
body:
Versions prior to 0.21.1 have high-severity security vulnerabilities.

Signed-off-by: Ryan Beck-Buysse <rbuysse@bitwise.io>

title: Delete SQL Merkle state on service purge
body: This PR implements the deletion of SQL merkle state on service purge.

title: Replace scabbard purge fn with trait
body: This change replaces the boxed function for handling state purge with a trait for the specific operation.  This gives a more concrete name for the operation.

title: Add release notes for Splinter 0.5.24
body: Signed-off-by: Andrea Gunderson <agunde@bitwise.io>
